CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, June 26, 1943, pg. 12, reads: "Pittsburgh's Own Son Matriculates at the United States Military Academy - Having completed his studies and received his sheepskin from the University of Pittsburgh. Andrew H. McCoy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew McCoy, Sr. of Terrace Village, will embark upon a military career July 1 when he enters the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York.  Mr. McCoy, with a splendid character reference and scholastic background, is the first race youth to be appointed by a Pennsylvania senator.  Honors go to Senator Joseph F. Guffey of Pennsylvania who made the appointment.  Above are pictures of the future Army officer and his loved ones... At the right in top row is a photo of the McCoy family.  Mr. and Mrs. McCoy and their son on a stroll through Schenley Park..."
TitMainTitle: Andrew McCoy Sr., Mrs. McCoy, and their son Andrew H. McCoy posed in park
